text: citizen Ruth is the first feature film
from the writer/director team of Jim
Taylor and Alexander Payne who also
brought us election sideways and About
Schmidt and even though it's more than
ten years old now I think citizen Ruth
is one of the best movies that I've ever
seen about what we call the culture wars
all of that stuff that never seems quite
to belong in the public discourse but is
always right there giving us more things
to argue about and yell at each other
about and just kind of make each other
feel bad about it the main character in
Citizen Ruth is Ruth Stoops wonderfully
played by Laura Dern a terrific comic
actress Ruth main passion in life is
getting high off of glue or spray paint
or whatever other inhalants she can find
and this clouds her judgement a little
bit although she wasn't all that smart
to begin with and at the beginning of
the movie she discovers that she's
pregnant after getting arrested judge
tries to compel her to end her pregnancy
and because of this she's taken up by a
group of anti-abortion militants called
the baby sabers who are a wonderful
study in Middle American smiley-faced
piety
oh the baby savers are not just a local
group they're a part of a national
network that's headed by a charismatic
and silver-tongued preacher played by
the great Burt Reynolds why don't you
tell me about this $15,000 the Ruth is
saved from the baby savers by a
collective of feminist pro-choice
activists who with their tea and their
frida kahlo t-shirts and their worship
of the moon represent a perfect
satirical counterpart to their enemies
hear us now fearless this is not a movie
that takes a side on the issue of
abortion and it pokes some pretty wicked
fun at both sides but that's not to say
that it's even-handed or neutral and and
it or inoffensive
on the contrary it's really exposing the
kind of the hypocrisy and the inflated
rhetoric and just the the blindness that
clouds so much political activism and it
shows that the ritual aspect the way
that the two sides in this battle kind
of depend on each other and in a way
cooperate with each other
the movie doesn't sentimentalize Ruth or
treat her like a wrong innocent that
would be the filmmakers exploiting her
much in the way that the activists on
the different sides do instead this is a
movie about an individual apathetic
obtuse dumb individual a citizen just
like the rest of us and the point of the
movie is that the idea of taking such a
person's life and making it into
ammunition in the culture wars or fodder
for some great cause is beyond absurd
it's the stuff of far
